Gamification: Introduce a fitness challenge in the office, where employees can earn points or badges for completing tasks such as walking a certain number of steps, standing for a certain amount of time, or participating in a fitness class. This can be a fun and engaging way to motivate employees to be more active.

Desk Yoga: Provide a yoga mat and a few yoga blocks at each desk and encourage employees to take a few minutes each day to stretch and do some simple yoga poses. This can help reduce stress and improve posture, as well as increase flexibility and mobility.

Standing Desks: Replace traditional desks with standing desks or adjustable desks that allow employees to stand while working. This can help reduce the amount of time employees spend sitting and improve their overall health and well-being.

Virtual Fitness Classes: Provide virtual fitness classes such as yoga, pilates, or HIIT workouts that employees can participate in from the comfort of their own desks. This can be a great way to get a workout in during the workday without having to leave the office.

Lunchtime Walks: Encourage employees to take a lunchtime walk around the block or around the office. This can be a great way to get some fresh air and exercise, as well as a chance to socialize with colleagues and clear the mind before returning to work.
